statement: Replace the legacy resume JSON with michael_scott_resume.json and update default asset references.
Seed full Michael Scott + David Brent resume data to exercise the resume builder (profile, skills, experience, education, founder roles, custom sections) using ASCII-only content.
Ensure asset imports via CLI are safe for real users (no overwrite without explicit override) and document the import workflow.
Keep dev/test runs isolated from user data (ephemeral or stub DB for test flows).
Run python harness.py --run-all-tests and record results for the new resume asset changes.
Compile the Michael Scott resume PDF using a stubbed DB and perform a vision review of the rendered output.
Ensure long resume names render on a single line in Typst by adjusting header layout and layering.
Convert the legacy resume PDF into a JSON asset that matches the import schema (profile, experience, education, founder_roles, skills).
Import the legacy resume JSON into Neo4j using the CLI import flag and capture the outcome.
Run python harness.py --run-all-tests and record results for the legacy resume import flow.
Render rasterized company description text using the summary tail color (SOFT_SECONDARY_FILL).
Allow literal < and > in bullet fields by escaping them for Typst rendering.
Increase bullet wrap leading to a medium amount for readability.
Render before/after PDFs via CLI and perform a Vision comparison to confirm bullet leading improvement.
Align Education date range formatting with Experience spacing (" - ").
Update AGENTS.md to make tests optional and require explicit requests before running them.
Tighten test policy to forbid production DB runs and mirror optional-test gating in docs/TESTING.md.
Inject the stop-list into the LLM prompt and enforce stop-list filtering with retries so prompt output avoids stop-list terms.
Improve the stop-list itself with added or refined forbidden phrases and cleaned duplication.
Expand the stop-list based on online research into high-tech resume buzzwords and management-speak cliches.
Update --run-all-tests to run the dockerized e2e flow (scripts/run_maxcov_e2e.sh --force), avoid recursion by adding a local runner, and support sudo password prompting via expect.
Fix warnings/errors reported by the run-all-tests static analysis suite.
Document that Neo4j backups are not required when tests run in ephemeral containers.
Run pytype outside the container and debug until it completes successfully.
Remove pytype from static analysis tooling and dependencies (deprecated).
Hard-code the working CLI tool invocations discovered into --run-all-tests.
Add CLI flags to run each static tool individually and verify they run via harness CLI args.
tests: python harness.py --ruff (and remaining static tool CLI args)

statement: Add recommended non-Python static tools and scanners (shellcheck, shfmt, hadolint, detect-secrets, check-jsonschema) to run-all-tests and CLI tooling, and install dependencies.
Add Python static tools pip-check, pipdeptree, and pydoclint to run-all-tests and CLI tooling, and install dependencies.
Get --run-all-tests working end-to-end in the current environment.
Remove static-tool skips/ignores and fix underlying findings so all tool checks pass without suppression.
Adjust Typst bullet marker alignment so bullets align with text; render before/after PDFs via CLI with stub DB and confirm via Vision review.
Align bullet center to the text line center by raising text relative to bullet markers in Typst; verify via CLI-rendered PDFs and Vision review until centered.
Ensure LinkedIn and GitHub contact entries render on the same line.
Provide recommendations for additional static Python tools to consider adding to the static analysis suite.
Add pyanalyze and refurb to the static analysis suite with CLI flags and dependencies.
Fail static analysis when a selected tool is missing, even if the tool would otherwise be skipped.
Resolve pyanalyze/refurb findings so their harness CLI runs complete without warnings.
Remove pyanalyze from the static analysis suite while keeping refurb enabled.
Upgrade the repo target/runtime to Python 3.14 (including Reflex compatibility updates).
Convert requirements.txt to environment.yaml (preserve dependency list).
Run each static tool individually via harness CLI args, verify Reflex run, then run end-to-end tests.
Update the Docker config to use Miniforge and Ubuntu 25.10 (questing).
Run a docker build to validate the Ubuntu 25.10 + Miniforge Docker config.
Confirm whether Reflex run uses uv in production for this repo.
Confirm whether Reflex projects usually use uv in production (general guidance).
Restore maximum-coverage results after the Python 3.14 upgrade by ensuring Reflex coverage is captured and confirm via a run-all-tests confirmation test.
Use mamba to create the conda environment from environment.yaml in the Dockerfile.
Use the base conda environment in the Dockerfile (no llm-harness env) and avoid conda updates when using mamba.
Replace the base-env update command with a base-env creation approach that avoids the Python 3.14 solver conflict while keeping the Miniforge installer script.
Use the Miniforge installer latest-download URL (uname-based) in the Dockerfile since multi-arch builds are not required.
Update the Dockerfile to run `mamba env update -n base -f environment.yaml` (base env update, not a new env).
Keep mamba available in the base env by pinning it in environment.yaml while using `mamba env update -n base`.
Keep conda available in the base env by pinning it in environment.yaml and removing prune from the base env update.
Use python:latest as the Docker base image and install dependencies with pip from requirements.txt.
Determine whether the Playwright Python image offers Python 3.14.
Answer what the Neo4j container implications are for the Docker/Compose setup.
Provide guidance for updating the codebase to adopt newly introduced Python 3.13/3.14 idioms and features.
Enhance harness.py to use Python 3.14 features.
Expand harness.py adoption of Python 3.14 features beyond minimal usage (t-strings, annotationlib, compression.zstd, and additional 3.14 syntax where applicable).
Further expand harness.py adoption of Python 3.14 features (concurrent interpreter usage, additional t-string usage) and validate the module compiles per user request.
Run static analysis tools concurrently using the interpreters API so each tool executes in its own interpreter.
On clicking the job requisition textarea, paste clipboard contents and run Generate Profile then Generate PDF via the existing pipeline handler.
List all declared function names in harness.py to confirm existing pipeline handlers.
Add ui-playwright-check coverage for the job requisition textarea click-to-paste pipeline.
Ensure ui-playwright-check selects a cheap LLM model (not gpt-5.2-pro) for pipeline runs.
Get `python harness.py --ui-playwright-check` working end-to-end.
Add `python harness.py --ui-playwright-check-docker` to run UI checks in Docker only.
Remove stub database usage so Docker UI tests run against a real Neo4j instance populated with Michael Scott's resume data.
Add `python harness.py --run-ui-tests` as a docker-only UI test gate (Neo4j + UI only).
Disallow LLM error bypasses in UI checks and fail fast on missing API keys.
Instrument UI Playwright checks with continuous heartbeat logs during long waits.
Add extremely fine-grained UI logging to confirm paste-from-clipboard-on-click within the first seconds of UI test execution.
Temporarily stop UI Playwright checks immediately after the click-to-paste validation (success or failure).
Update the LLM chooser to include valid OpenAI gpt-5.2* models as a static list (no dynamic fetch) and include the latest GPT-5 mini model.
Refresh the Gemini model list and make a Gemini 3 model the default LLM choice.
Load Gemini API keys from ~/geminikey.txt by default (env overrides) and wire Docker UI tests to use it.
Restore full UI Playwright coverage by running all UI steps after the click-to-paste check (no early bail by default).
Tune UI_MAX_RUNTIME to be a couple minutes longer than the computed --run-ui-tests duration.
Ensure `python harness.py --run-all-tests` works and record the result.
Measure `--run-all-tests` runtime and set a default max runtime a couple minutes longer than the measured value.
Scrub repo PII related to the user, including any stored messages in logs/metadata and PII artifacts.
Delete and recreate the GitHub repo via the in-repo Python bootstrap script after the PII scrub.
Revert the Gemini completion usage-metadata workaround to restore the prior behavior.
Improve LLM JSON extraction so Stage 1 profile generation succeeds for the job requisition in req.txt.
Retry the LLM call when JSON output is rejected, up to a configurable N attempts.
Strengthen JSON-retry handling so req.txt on gemini-3-pro-preview retries with corrective prompts and higher default attempts.
Ensure --run-ui-tests selects the same LLM model as the user (gemini-3-pro-preview).
Empirically measure --run-ui-tests runtime with gemini-3-pro-preview and set UI_MAX_RUNTIME to measured + buffer.
Add a standalone any-llm probe to call gemini-3-pro-preview with prompt.yaml + req.txt and report JSON parse success.
Fix Stage 1 non-JSON failures for gemini-3-pro-preview so UI pipeline completes and UI tests pass.
Log Stage 1 LLM JSON output to make it easy to verify success, then inspect the logged output.
Add extremely fine-grained logging to any_llm_prompt_probe.py to debug LLM JSON responses.
Add a Generate PDF (with cache busting) button that forces a fresh PDF render even when the cached signature matches.
Shorten the cache-busting PDF button label so it fits without wrapping.
Keep LinkedIn and GitHub contacts together even when GitHub uses a non-github.com URL.
Keep "Generate Profile" and "Generate PDF" button labels on a single line.
Keep "Refresh PDF" button label on a single line.
Remove the separate "Include Skills section" toggle and rely on Section Order visibility.
Put Auto-fit and Pages on the same line as the Rewrite bullets with LLM toggle.
Remove the "Paste & Run" and "Run Pipeline" buttons from the Job Requisition header row.
Use a more professional, less clash-y color scheme for the primary action buttons.
Add a Profile chooser that lists date/time, company, and role for selecting which Profile to load.
Match the Profile chooser width to the Model chooser width.
Keep the Profile chooser within the app's right edge.
Ensure the Profile chooser stays within the app container even for long labels.
Use Dynoselect for the Profile chooser.
Replace the Profile chooser with Select2.
Default the Profile chooser to the top 100 most recent and support searching all Profiles in Neo4j.
Fix reflex run crash by updating FastAPI Query defaults to be compatible with the installed version.
Run a basic reflex run smoke test and log the result.
Fix the Profile selector so only one Select2 control renders and placeholder/search behave normally.
Verify the Profile selector fix via reflex run + browser DOM check and API response.
Fix Select2 search so results load without "results could not be loaded" errors.
Verify Select2 search results load before and after typing.
Match the Profile chooser styling (box + text) to the Model chooser.
Load cached PDF when a Profile is selected, and use the selected Profile when Refresh PDF is clicked.
Scrub repo of user PII and update GitHub handle references to mingusb.
Delete and recreate the GitHub repo from scratch, then push a fresh history for the current codebase.
Remove non-distributable fonts from the repo and recreate the GitHub repo with a fresh history.
Restore local custom fonts outside git after repo recreation.
Update AGENTS instructions to forbid verbatim user request capture and require neutral summaries.
Support <date> tags in bullet text across sections and drop the pipe-delimited date format.
Delete and recreate the GitHub repo using the bootstrap script.
Recreate the repo with a clean Git history and push a fresh main branch.
Delete the remote repo, remove local .git, and recreate the repo from scratch.
Provide a script to delete the remote repo, remove local .git, recreate the repo, and push a fresh main branch on demand.
Remove the failing GitHub Action from the repo.
Rewrite README.md to be professional and include top badges (view counter and project stats).
Review README.md for accuracy against the repo and report discrepancies.
Rewrite README.md to match best-in-class GitHub README quality.
Read all documentation and state/log files, then revise README.md based on that review.
Perform a marketing-focused rewrite of README.md.
Run the repo reset script to delete/recreate the remote and rebuild local git history.
